1.author: Kin Hubbard
1.quote: Nobody ever forgets where he buried the hatchet.

2.author: Don Marquis
2.quote: When a man tells you that he got rich through hard work, ask him: 'Whose?'

3.author: Sean O'Casey
3.quote: All the world's a stage and most of us are desperately unrehearsed.

4.author: James Joyce
4.quote: Christopher Columbus, as everyone knows, is honored by posterity because he was the last to discover America.

5.author: Les Dawson
5.quote: I used to sell furniture for a living. The trouble was, it was my own.

7.author: Sinclair Lewis
7.quote: People will buy anything that is 'one to a customer.'

8.author: Jackie Kennedy
8.quote: A camel makes an elephant feel like a jet plane.

9.author: Rodney Dangerfield
9.quote: I haven't spoken to my wife in years. I didn't want to interrupt her.

10.author: Jules Renard
10.quote: Laziness is nothing more than the habit of resting before you get tired.

11.author: Samuel Goldwyn
11.quote: A wide screen just makes a bad film twice as bad.

12.author: Saul Bellow
12.quote: When we ask for advice, we are usually looking for an accomplice.

13.author: Garry Shandling
13.quote: I'm dating a woman now who, evidently, is unaware of it.

14.author: Will Rogers
14.quote: I don't make jokes. I just watch the government and report the facts.

15.author: Lily Tomlin
15.quote: I personally think we developed language because of our deep need to complain.

16.author: Groucho Marx
16.quote: A hospital bed is a parked taxi with the meter running.

17.author: George Burns
17.quote: Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city.
